website_summaries.verdict: Klipsch's ultracomfortable, noise-isolating ear tips are just one of the reasons I love and recommend the S4-series headphones. If you're an Android user shopping for a new pair of earbuds, the Image S4A headphones are definitely worth the $99.
pros: The Klipsch S4A Headphones for Android earn our favor with powerful 8.5mm drivers, comfortable ear tips, and an accompanying Android app that smartphone owners can use to remap the in-line remote controls
cons: The headphones perform inconsistently on devices running Android 2.1 and lower

customer_reviews.title: After 5+ years, still my go-to earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for over 5 years, and they are still my go-to earbuds. The sound quality is excellent, they are extremely comfortable, and I've had no quality issues at all - I've read some of the negative reviews, and I can't relate. I've got several other earbuds but I still really like and use these a lot. They aren't wireless, so I don't use them for exercising, but I use these for work and personal phone calls and listening to music and podcasts when I'm not moving around. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Required App Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Because this is one click, you have to map the buttons. While the earbuds sound good, the volume control on any newer android phone will NOT work. Klipsch is aware of this and has no plans on updating the app. As of now, it has not been updated in over a year. Beyond that, the app doesn't work with Sirius, Spotify, or my podcast app. Good hardware with bad software has ruined this product. I did not see anything about this not working when I made my purchase, so I hope this saves someone the grief. I cannot link to the app on the play store, but it is very easy to find. Notice the overwhelming 1 star reviews...
customer_reviews.author: AzRockDad

customer_reviews.title: wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a lot of headphones...tried many earbuds...and these so far are the best I've used! Of course I haven't bought any ear buds over a hundred like I have for my travel on ear and over the ear headphones so can not compare to over one hundred dollar head phones but bought these when they went on sell making them slightly higher then ones I returned and they sound infinitely better! Way more comfertable as well, the sizes are small so I have to use the large but the fit great! And I can see my self wearing them almost indefinitely with out hurting my ears! Definitely would recommend these to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Ash Huston

customer_reviews.title: Broken After 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: This Klipsch Image S4A headphone is a multipurpose listening headphone mostly used while traveling to work and in the gym. Within 6 months the right headphone intermittently stopped working. Then it stopped for a month, and now it's back to an intermittent status. Since it is still under warranty I called Klipsch for repair or replacement. Before being allowed to return I needed to email the receipt along with shipping information and phone number. Once that information is reviewed Klipsch will determine if they will accept it as a return or repair. Consider passing on this brand for one that offers higher quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Global Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Descent Headphones for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a lot of in ear headphones. I keep going back to these because they are a good value for the sound quality and have a microphone (for making calls). Also they are pretty comfortable. After about a year of heavy usage the connector started to get loose cutting sound from one of the earbuds. This has happened to many of my headphones so it's not atypical. However, Klipsh should figure out a way to prevent this from happening. Also I've tried running/jogging in these headphones, but they either slide off or get clogged with sweat (gross).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin N.

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I read reviews on cnet about the best earphones(plugs) to buy. I am a huge fan of the bose IE series and was trying this out as a cheaper alternative. Well it IS a CHEAP alternate. sound quality is cheap. the build quality is cheap. The sound gets cut off at times if the wires are tangled up. I would not recommend this to anyone. Please dont get fooled by the cnet reviews. The best sub $50 earplugs i have used thus far is the Creative EP-630. For a more picky music buff I would recommend the BOSE MiE2.
customer_reviews.author: Aravind

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the instructions to get the Klipsch app.  Not needed.
customer_reviews.text: The app that you're supposed to use with the earphones is no longer available, but you don't need it to use the earphones. They work fine without the app.
customer_reviews.author: Shoshana Berkovic

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of earphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used these for about a year till I moved on and got the Jaybird bluebud x since I wanted to use a Bluetooth set for the gym and while these are great I had a few issues with these. about 6 months after I bought them the plastic that is directly under the earphone started to rip off. The silicone ear tips also started to easily come off around 7-8 months after I bought them and I almost lost one. While I love the sound of these I felt it could of used a little bit more bass but the overall sound quality is great for the price ( I paid about $90 a year ago)
customer_reviews.author: B. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Unable to utilize the warranty service.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the headphones, it was brand new and working great. 8 months later, the mic stopping working. When I used it for phone calls, my voice would come in and out. I contacted the seller (Dave Parkers) for warranty service and I was told to contact Klipsch instead, which I did. Then I was informed by Klipsch that because I purchased the headphones from an unauthorized seller, they can't provide me any warranty service. Lesson learned, just because you purchase the headphone from Amazon, depends on the actual seller, you WILL not be able to utilize Klipsch's warranty service.
customer_reviews.author: JCfromLA

customer_reviews.title: Keep falling of my ears
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great, but I'm constantly placing back them in my ears. Even after some wind blowing the other day, they fell off. I tried the different adapters and none of them will keep them in my ears. That's the first time I'm having this kind of issues with earphones. Also they kind of look cheap. On top of that the plug started top break after a month. Amazon doesn't let me return them. $50 for nothing. I recently bought the Monster iSport Strive instead: loving them. Avoid Klipsch brand
customer_reviews.author: Lionel L.

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: The mids and highs are nice and clear, but bass is honestly anemic. The Sennheiser CX??? earbud headphones I bought for about 1/4 the price have FAR superior sound quality. Considering the price tag and the Klipsch name attached to them, I was very disappointed. Pretty sure Klipsch just sold me the last set of headphones they'll ever get me to buy. Are they decent headphones - Yes. Are they decent $70+ dollar headphones? No, not worth it, not even close.
customer_reviews.author: Sappy

customer_reviews.title: Great for audiobooks.
customer_reviews.text: I borrow audiobooks from the library, and the recordings are sometimes lousy, because they are recorded off scratched CD's. These headphones eliminate almost ALL of the hissss sounds. The upper range sounds are clear: the "F", "S", and "H" sounds spoken by the reader are clear! They are well made, and I recommend them, even though volume control does not work. However, the software does make my Samsung GS3 open the right program when they are connected. That is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Good sound when seated properly,
customer_reviews.text: Great sound when they are seated correctly in ear. One of few in-ear headphones i've ever used that fit my ears. I run the the wires from behind my head then over my ears and they fit and stay in much better that way. Decent ambient noise reduction when they are in properly as well (note these are NOT active noise cancelling). Cord tangles easily because the texture sort of grips itself when wrapped up.
customer_reviews.author: jkhouw1

customer_reviews.title: Right side doesn't qo
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones! When they work. Right side works intermittently. Really disappointed, have usually had great experiences with Klipsch but I guess that's what I get for buying from a third party seller 🤷
customer_reviews.author: E YOUNG

customer_reviews.title: It's about the app and the app sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Any set of Klipsch's headphones in this price range are going to give about the same sound quality. The whole point of this device is that it's supposed to bring inline controls to Android and it fails utterly to do that. I have found regular iPhone headphones to be just as good, if not better, at controlling my music. The reason for this is the virtually useless app you're supposed to download to facilitate the control. It sucks. Click twice to skip tracks? 60% of the time it pauses. OK, so click once to un-pause? No. Doesn't work. I like Klipsch headphones and I will probably order more, but I don't see the point bothering with this gimmick again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Scheer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for sound, bad for bass
customer_reviews.text: The sound these headphones produce is nice and clear, but the bass is WHACK! I listen to alot of R&B, Hip Hop, Pop, Rock, Dance and Electronica. I do like the audio control, the mic is ok, but when listening to a phone call thru these headphones are a pain, as I can barely hear the other person. I recommended staying away from this one, just go with the SkullCandy TItan, pretty good highs and meds, with a killer bass, comes with audio control and a mic and works great during a phone call
customer_reviews.author: Alzeau Maiti

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Ear Buds
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair of ear candy ear buds for about 2 years now and was looking to get a 2nd pair. I did some searching and found this headset been reviewed by CNET. Honestly I was blown away by the quality of sound the moment I used them. They came in a nice cloth case with a zipper. The only thing I have an issue is the thin cables. If not for the cables I would give this 5 stars. But honestly for the money, they are worth every penny. Acoustics are just phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair, only because I wore out one set (they still work & sound great but no mic) and accidentally broke a wire on another. The sounds ring true, deep bass, awesome mids and great highs IMHO. The controller works great with the app on my GS4, simple and easy to use. I found these for about 40% off vs a box store. My only complaint is that you need to readjust them a few times if you're working out. Other than that I wouldn't spend a dime on anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Cfrausto

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of Ear Buds
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace some Sony ones my dog ate, lotta cord which is good even though I use with Bluetooth reciever work fine plugged in to the phone as well, not used the Android ap but might try it, not really seen a need for it as I use a bluetooth receiver typically. Call quality is fine, music is fine but I use a couple equalizer aps so can't say what they sound like flat. Decent little case too holds them and my bluetooth receiver fine. Only knock I got is the cord does like to tangle.
customer_reviews.author: William Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are some good earphones but I would have given them 5 stars but the design is a little off or it may just be my ears there is an angle on them that makes them hard to fit in the ear unless I wear them upside down with the cord going up over and behind my ears which I do any way when doing something active so that I don't snag the cord on anything other than that they sound good and was a good value
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Combine these earbuds with the Triple flange, trilevel - Earphones Plus brand replacement ear cushions made to fit Klipsch and you have a great combo that sound great and remain comfortably in place. I've worn them almost daily for a couple of years and love them. Comfortable enough that I sleep with them in sometimes to block noise.
customer_reviews.author: SuperJack

customer_reviews.title: They sound fine, but the are terrible when it comes to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have own two pairs of these earplugs. One of the earplugs went dead on the 1st set after a few months and figured it was something I did. So I ordered a new pair a few months ago and one of the earplugs went dead on the 2nd pair. They sound fine, but the are terrible when it comes to durability. Do not buy them unless you just want something to throw away after a few months
customer_reviews.author: Rell Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: After dunking my Bose earbuds in coffee cup, I went searching for a new pair, preferably a bit less expensive, but same quality and designed for an Android device. . Web results led me to order this set of earbuds... and I love them! I downloaded an equalizer app to control the sound experience even further. I listen to a lot of file scores and classical music, so quality is important to be able to hear variations in instrumentation, dynamics, etc. I love them so much, I purchased a second pair for my hubby.
customer_reviews.author: MKC

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through many headphones in search of the perfect earbuds and these are by far the best for the price. I already have some over the ear that were pricey and wanted some nice earbuds but didn't want to spend a lot. In my opinion, these sound nearly as good as my previous Bose earbuds which cost $150 however, these have the added bonus of actually fitting in my ear and isolating some of the outside noise whereas the $150 Bose did not do this at all, though they were not meant to. As for the fit, I have small ears and these fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: lc

customer_reviews.title: Ability to use inline controls for PC would would rate it a 5
customer_reviews.text: OK, after some relativeiy extensive reviews found Klipsch Image S4A In-ear Headphones for Android as the only Android option with both inline controls and a mike. Worked exactly a advertised once I downloaded the phone control app; however, used Jay's Headset Control instead of Klipsch and have never looked back. Stock earbuds are very comfortable and isolate external noise. Works great with the phone ( Samsung Galaxy Nexus S2 ), and only gripe so far is that I can't use inline controls when I use the headphones with my PC - unless there's a control app out there I haven't been able to find yet.
customer_reviews.author: gmac

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are a little cheaper than the old discontinued headphones without the Android functionality. A great pair of headphones with great sound quality. I had a pair that lasted me for a few years and finally the sound jack portion broken and I had to get a new pair. I would highly recommend these headphones because they are what I would consider Bose quality for a little over half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim86

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great bass reproduction, comfortable fit, good noise canceling (for earbuds), and the microphone is very clear. Con: Cannot figure out how to control volume. They say there is a long press function, but I've never found it to work. The wire is also a bit troublesome, it gets stuck on things easily and pulls out the headphones, and it can make noise, but you can't hear the noise it's making unless music isn't playing. All in all, a great set of earbuds, but some work should be done on the wire.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound with just the right amount of bass for me. I have never had really nice earphones before. On sale I was able to pick them up. Over all I am very happy with my purchase. I gave 4 stars because of the stupid idea of making the right ear cord so much longer that the left. I ended up tying several loose knots into it to make it match the left side.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Big Sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great! We use them with an iPhone and the switch still works even though it says they are for an Andriod. It's nice that they come with the different size earbuds. Very comfortable to wear. Why pay a ton for a newer model or a different brand when you can get so much out of this great product!
customer_reviews.author: NCcakegirl

customer_reviews.title: Better than the iphone version!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair- I bought one 2 years ago and have worn it out and bought this as a back up. I recommend this brand/style to EVERYONE. Do not buy the iphone version even if you have an iphone. It's cheaper, the rubber is thinner, and it seems like it will break. On top of that, the microphone is miserable for making calls. I have owned both. I thought the iphone version was defective so I bought another at the apple store. Same bad quality. Do yourself a favor, but this one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E. Maston

customer_reviews.title: Nice item, at 100$ I would not buy it
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are quite nice, with crisp sounds I don't have anything to complain about. It maybe because of the lack of quality my music archives have, but I have not been amazed, and that's the reason of the missing star. I like them, don't love them. At 46$ It's quite a bargain, at 100$ (original price), I would think it more than twice before buying and after testing them.
customer_reviews.author: Rubén Rodríguez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headset meant to last.
customer_reviews.text: This headset is amazing. The sound quality is crisp and clear, and the bass will give you chills up your spine. I have had this headset for a couple months and I have never been happier with a pair of headphones/ headset. Although they are great headphones, they also provide a great hands free experience. Call quality is the best I have heard and the music experience is also worth the price. I would definitely recommend this headset to any android phone user.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but maybe a little overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Sound quality is excellent. -Ear buds are very comfortable compared to some cheaper brands. -Blocks outside sound pretty well. Cons: -Not the most durable. I've taken good care of the headphones, gently winding them and storing them in a protective case; however, the material at the top of the cord near the earbuds already split. -I previously had less expensive Sony headphones that were pretty comparable in sound quality and comfort. They cost less and lasted several years.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Button didnt last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought for work as I use them for mild hearing protection and listening to my music on my android 40+ hours a week. At about one month of use the mic and single button have stopped working. the headphones still sound great and block out noise well, i just cant use any of the extra features. I guess theyre not for heavy use as after a month they had over 160 hours on them with the button being pressed maybe 1000 times.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Bought these based on Klipsch's good reviews online
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based on Klipsch's good reviews online. They were great for about 5 months. Then, the right ear stopped working. Klipsch has a two-year warranty, but would not return or exchange, because I bought them on Amazon from "DirectDeals4U." They are not an "authorized reseller." So, neither the seller or the manufacturer would provide a solution...not even an exchange, or willingness to repair. Don't buy these, and definitely don't buy from unauthorized resellers!
customer_reviews.author: Shecky

customer_reviews.title: Droid Razr with ICS not compatible.
customer_reviews.text: Here is a note from the Klipsch website. As you can see, the Klipsch Control does not support Droid Razr with ICS (4.0). I was looking for a headphone that worked with Android. This is one of the few that I found, Unfortunately, it does not support Droid Razr with ICS. [...] A note about compatibility: Motorola Droid Razr (running Android 4.0 or later) When running Android 4.0 or later MotoBlur conflicts with Klipsch Control, preventing the device from properly receiving button commands. Klipsch Control continues to work properly on the Droid Razr with Android 2.3.6 and on other devices running Android 4.0.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Foran

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my ipod and droid phone - it works for both. It provides excellent quality of sound for both uses. It also seems to provide good sound for those on the receiving end of phone calls. I see now that it has been discontinued by the manufacturer, but I got it for the very low price noted ($37 and change) and that is soooo worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ljvirgo

customer_reviews.title: awesome, wish they had dedicated volume controls
customer_reviews.text: These iems do great at blocking out sound, and despite other reviews to the contrary, it isn't necessary to install the control app for use of the remote. At the very least, pause/play and skip seem to work on my Nexus 10 and Samsung Galaxy s3. However, no volume control without the app, and since the app locks you down to one media app, I think I'll pass
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Advertised feature does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed by sound quality. Wish they used heavier gauge wiring. These headphones feel very flimsy, considering the cost. Microphone works fine. Long-press to adjust volume does not work. There is an Android app that is supposed to be installed. Changelog in the app indicates that this problem was fixed, but long-press still didn't work for me. The app somehow managed to bring my Galaxy S3 to a crawl, so I uninstalled it anyway. Instead, I used Tasker to create a profile that sets media volume upon headset plugin, and resets it when unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: volume control does not work on new android
customer_reviews.text: since android 4.0+, the long pause hold to update volume by system default goes to OK Google. volume control is one of main reasons I got these. also the calls via mic sounds muffled to the other end. I'm also very confused why the regular not for android version of these buds costs more.. but that's just a side comment
customer_reviews.author: provkitir

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work with HTC Droid DNA
customer_reviews.text: I just got them today and installed the S4A Klipsch app on my HTC Droid DNA, when I press double-click it takes you to next track but also launches phone app and re-dails, which is really annoying. No complaints with the sound quality (I just upgraded from my old Klipsch earphones without mic). Also I was kind of expecting a seperate volume button on the mic, apparently pressing the single button on the mic for long is supposed to control the volume which isn't working either on my Droid DNA. Hopefully these control issues can be fixed with their next upgrade of the Android app.
customer_reviews.author: venchi

customer_reviews.title: best headphones ever !
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of Klipsch s4 headphones. My fist set was the s4i but since I have an Android phone I purchased a new set the s4a. I tell you the sound is incredible . I heard my favorite music again for the first time it sounded that good. I have sold high end audio before so I know what it sounds like and it sounds like Klipsch s4a headphones.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: What else could you ask for? Absolutely the best sound for this price range(and better than some Sennheiser and Bose ear buds that are twice as much, or more). The microphone is clear, and it blocks out almost all ambient noise. Perfect for answering calls while walking around. For this price range, I can't imagine how anyone could have complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Sound great, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I'll give this five stars for sound quality, one star for the poor app that they state works with the headphones, and four for the packaging/case that comes with them. The treble, mids and lows, are all solid and I'd state that I almost feel like I'm getting the full value for these headphones with the exception being that the control doesn't play well with the Motorola DROID RAZR MAXX HD (XT936).
customer_reviews.author: Stryker

customer_reviews.title: These headphones do the job and then some
customer_reviews.text: I received these headphones as a gift and I am very happy with them. They provide great base, good mid and treble, and decent noise isolation. They stay in your ears even when running, as long as they aren't yanked and there 5 different ear bud styles/sizes to get the best fit. I have also used these for hours at a time and they have never hurt my ears like other headphones have. They are great performers that I recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound.
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are nicely balanced when it comes to sound. The highs are not overly bright. The bass is not boomy. The mid range and vocals are clear. I bought these to replace a pair of Skullcandy Titans. The Titans seemed to have a little more bass and are very well balanced as well. The Klipsch just seem to be a little clearer but not leaps and bounds ahead of the Skullcandy. The Klipsch fit in ear is very comftorable. All in all good sound, good fit, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and great durability
customer_reviews.text: I really like this earphones, sound quality is great but most important they have lasted longer than a year with me! I have abused this earphones, twice in the washer and dryer! I have owned two Bose and three Sennheiser earphones. I can't complain about the sound quality of these but when it comes to durability nothing compares the Klipsch's.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mock

customer_reviews.title: Great product, wish it wasn't discontinued
customer_reviews.text: Great product, this is the second one I've purchased (left the first set on an airplane). Lightweight, great sound, and little noise from cable movement (the new R6m line from Klipsch, which is supposed to be the successor to this, I found distinctly unpleasant to use mostly because of the cable design).
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Watching a movie sounds like the movie theatre with these things!
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones and have been using them nonstop. The quality is unparalleled and the comfort of them is top notch. Like others said, I don't have big ear canals but changed out to the larger tip size and they fit perfect. The software to control the button on the other hand is absolute junk. The most basic thing 'pause' instead of pausing Pandora it launches the phone's internal music player and starts playing my audiobook. I rated the app accordingly and won't dock the headphones for that issue.
customer_reviews.author: eatyourbroccoli

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones but lasted 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I use my android phone a lot. Daily use, sometimes for hours for podcasts and music. These headphones were nice, the button was fine but didn't always work predictably. Worked great on airplanes though and removed a lot of background noise. Sometimes the button would get caught on my shirt collar when I'd look around, minor annoyance. The problem is 7 months after I purchased these headphones the left headphone stopped working. Back to looking for something else, I may try to use the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Great sound for earbuds. Handy storage pouch that gets used every day. Be aware, that like all noise isolation ear buds, when you use them for a phone call it is hard to judge the volume of your own voice and it is not pleseast to talk when your ears are plugged with them. My solution: for phone calls only use the ear bud with the mic in the cord, leave the other ear bud out.
customer_reviews.author: Steel_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good, except for the bass
customer_reviews.text: After my third pair of Skullcandy 50/50s broke, I thought it would be a good idea to try something different. I like the shape of the Image S4A. They fit very comfortably in my ears, and don't slip out very easily. The Android control also works perfectly. I'm running Android 4.1.1, and I don't need to install the app for the controls to work. They don't let much outside noise through, just like most in-ear headphones, but you still can hear some. The one problem I've found with the Image S4A is that the bass is not as distinguished. On my 50/50s, the bass was loud and clear. The S4A doesn't have as high-quality bass as the 50/50s.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: The sound and tone were amazing. Problem is the plug that goes into phone ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound and tone were amazing. Problem is the plug that goes into phone basically came apart and wires eventually broke. I only kept it in my pocket with no activity unless you call riding in a golf cart high activity. It lasted about 4 months and want to return these. Too much $ for flimsey crap
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Toth

customer_reviews.title: They sound good. I wouldn't say they are amazing or anything
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if they are real or fake... They sound good. I wouldn't say they are amazing or anything. My Galaxy S4 OEM headphones sound the same if not better actually. I thought these have volume control... they don't.
customer_reviews.author: MagicMan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing sound and no support from Klipsch
customer_reviews.text: First... the headphones sound no better than the pair that came with my Galaxy s3. Second... the SINGLE button does nothing. Not even with the app installed. Third... the mic is awful. The caller on the other end complains of lots of noise. Fourth... Klipsch refuses to support the headphones because BESTDEAL TECH is not an authorized dealer. In other words, steer clear of this product and anything else Klipsch sells (because of the authorized dealer excuse).
customer_reviews.author: S. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Terrible Software brings it down. 4 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: These In-ear Headphones sounds great for the money. My only complaint is the single button remote. It leaves a lot to be desired, and the Klipsch App is just garbage. Other than that one complaint, these are solid In-ears. I gave them a good 24 HR burn in before i started really listening to the way the sounded. Unfortunately, my personal pair were eaten by my roommates dog, so I will be replacing them with the AudioTechnica ATH-M50s, but make not mistake when I need another pair of In-Ears, I will definitely pick up another pair of the Klipsch S4A's
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones; I've bought
customer_reviews.text: My favorite headphones; I've bought, destroyed, and re-bought this model a few times. Good frequency balance with clear but not obnoxious bass. They don't stick out of your ear too far (important when you are wearing a motorcycle helmet with these in).
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hansen

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is the in-line control once in a while. Otherwise, they sound excellent. I could write a loonngg review on these, but don't need to. They make your music collection come alive and sound new again. There are a few who have said there's too much bass. Can you say, "turn it down"? Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: G.T.B

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones for Android phones
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other headphones to use in the car, but these sound the best to ME, and folks I'm talking to seem to hear and even understand much of what I'm saying to them! Guess it doesn't get any better than that! Also great for listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them to bits. Best deal on the internet
customer_reviews.text: At under US$50, these are about half the price of the ones in Singapore. Sound Quality is above average, but I suppose they will do. Sadly I have already lost one rubber piece (the double-flange) which do an awesome job at noise isolation.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lye

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: The are great sounding buds. THey are comfortable as well. My only complaint is the flimsy-feeling cable. While I haven't experienced a problem, the wire doesn't feel substantial enough for this quality of product.
customer_reviews.author: Bret L Berry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound
customer_reviews.text: Love the earbuds sounds awesome Klipsch is a great product have a pair of heresies love them
customer_reviews.author: joe mejia

customer_reviews.title: Best In-ear headphones out there for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I never felt as happy after spending money on a product as i did on these awesome buds. Its been an year and these are still holding up after heavy and rough usage. great sound staging, u will feel that excitement while listening to these unlike the sennheiser CX series . The bass is decent and not over powering . Great comfort for long listening periods. Used the sennheiser CX series as well as few sony in-ear's and also tried skull candy .. trust me none can beat these for uder 90$. Go for it
customer_reviews.author: Ravi C.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, tangle free and ???waterproof???
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. Never use the control button, but the sound is fantastic. I also use them a decent amount to talk on the phone and they've worked great. What prompted me to write this review is that last week I thought I had killed them by accidentally putting them on my desk with one ear-bud submerged in a cup of water over night, but to my delight they still work fine! I also love the little case that they came with. No more tangled cords!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: very light and has a long cable.
customer_reviews.text: Cant find the app that it suggests I download to assist with use
customer_reviews.author: Beautiful Tulip

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and design. You can't go wrong with these headphones. Be careful with the mic volume control. Pressure can break it but that goes for any headphones with controls. Great for Metal to Techno and classical. Highly recommend. I wear them while riding my Harley and they provide great sound especially on a loud bike.
customer_reviews.author: William Foutch

customer_reviews.title: No sound out of right ear
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my Galaxy S4 and there was no sound being produced out of the right ear. Yes, it was secured in the earphone jack. I immediately returned this. The one ear that I did get sound out of did produce good sound. Went with another brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing impressive
customer_reviews.text: This product is nothing impressive, the build quality is cheap, cable are thin the pouch is same quality that you find in a dollar store. Quality of the sound is alright, I wish they had more button on the controller there is a constant static noise during calls. I will not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: These in-ear headphones have very clear sound and good build quality. I like the design too. But what I didn't like was the lack of bass and volume. Compared with the free Sony headphones I got in the box with my Xperia S, the lack of oomph was even more apparent. These headphones are for you if you value clarity over special effects.
customer_reviews.author: tyun

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've purchased for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best Headphones I've purchased for the money. For my taste, these blow the Bose in ear speakers away. The Bose may go lower in bass response, but the rest of the signal is muddy and dull in comparison to the Klipsch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Somerville

customer_reviews.title: fits snuggly in my ears pleaseing sound
customer_reviews.text: this is my second pair of klipsch head phone highs and lows are good enough enough for a small set of ear buds the one disconcerting fact is trying to talk with the head phones you don't hear your self talk other than that the ear buds fit very snugly in your ear
customer_reviews.author: drwho

customer_reviews.title: Great when they worked...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these April 6th. The left ear bud stopped working today.. The sound quality was amazing very clear i used them on my laptop and my phone.. Since it only worked for a brief time im not impressed... Don't think ill get another due to this experience...
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch Image S4A
customer_reviews.text: Overall sound quality stands out and microphone is excellent with location near mouth. Bass is above average but sadly you can't ask for more from In-ear headphones. Noise isolation is passive and just ok. Definetly good for music lovers. Comfortable in ear for long use. There is a pouch for storage when not using and clip to attach to shirt so there is less chance of loosing when on the move. Button control is not good at all, the response is laggy. I specifically ordered them for my S2, later I found their app at Google Play doesn't support S2. (face palm) But thanks to good quality sound output I don't have any complains.
customer_reviews.author: Zeesh

customer_reviews.title: Decent headset.  Very good price.
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, especially for the price. I use daily with a Samsung Galaxy S2, and I have no problems talking while downtown in high traffic or while driving. Music quality is very good, for the price. I went from higher-priced multi-speaker units from Ultimate Ears, and I am satisfied with the Klipsch. I expect for this headset to last me at least two years.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jang

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones, excellent sound quality, real comfortable, and the button is in the perfect place. My only issue with them is the wire is sticky which could be a good thing so it doesn't slide around but if you run the wire inside your shirt it sort of tacks on your collar and when turn you head it feels like they might pull out of your ear. The tackyness of the wire does not help with untangling either. I would definitely buy them again for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: TheLetterJ

customer_reviews.title: awesome, better than my bose...
customer_reviews.text: these fit, feel and sound phenominal and they literally blow away my 127.00 bose headphones and my dre dr. beats. i 5 star em all day long. they rock me to a furry little nub. jus sayin
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: Not for my ears, perhaps for yours...
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are not comfortable in my ears. I even purchased comply ear tips, to see if they would fit better, or be more comfortable, but they weren't. I've compared them side-by side with a pair of Bose that I've used for years. The Bose are much more comfortable, and sound better. The Klipsch isolate outside noise better, but the Bose are better fitting, more comfortable, and sound better. My ears are not the same as yours, however. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is GREAT and perfect fit. Should have cost twice the price for such a good pair of headphones. The base is also top notch. This is my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love these buds
customer_reviews.text: Love these buds. I wear them under my motorcycle helmet. They block out a fair bit of the engine noise but I can still hear my surroundings. This allows me to keep the volume a bit lower.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T.

customer_reviews.title: App and controls do not work with Jellybean platform!!
customer_reviews.text: The controls and app do not function if your phone is using jellybean. When you click contols it sends phone to Google Voice search. The sound however is excellent and plugs are comfortable, I rate sound 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: da cap10

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I could be reading a book and a person could be yelling at me, right in front, and I'd be oblivious with these things in my air. Amazing noise cancellation, and great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Mallios

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. The angled earpiece fits so comfortably, and the sound is great. I have 2 other sets of headphones, one inexpensive and one medium priced. These are my favorites and were worth the price. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalGal

customer_reviews.title: ... for a long time and they have held up pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for listening to my music and taking calls on the phone for a long time and they have held up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: ChronicVader

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for android users
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set of earphones as a gift for a friend who is a big fan of music but not an audiophile in any way. As soon as he tried the earphones he was impressed with the sound quality - above anything else he had owned so far in his opinion. He also liked the fact that it was fully compatible with his android phone, and has been happily using it for the past few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: The Klipsch headphones work well with my phone although I had been spoiled by the complete freedom of movement with a Bluetooth headset. That said, the sound, especially with both buds in, is infinitely better. I have also stopped carrying my midgrade noise cancelling headphones on airplanes in lieu of the Klipsch. They sound better and do about as good of a job keeping jet noise form my ears.
customer_reviews.author: John Johnson

customer_reviews.title: These headphones sound pretty good as an upgrade from basic earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound pretty good as an upgrade from basic earbuds. They stay in your ear pretty well....as long as you're not moving.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Howell

customer_reviews.title: These ear buds are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. The only thing is the ability to adjust the treble down a bit. Other than that, they don't hurt your ears and the sound is fantastic. I received these on time and they were actually better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: bad ear bud on mine
customer_reviews.text: On the pair I received, the right ear bud was not working, they didn't look like they had been abused, and the seller quickly sent me a pair of a different kind. They seem very fragile, but they work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Reeves

customer_reviews.title: What A Treat For My Ears!
customer_reviews.text: Finally ear buds that don't hurt my ears. The design is comfortable, the microphone allows the folks I am talking to to hear me clearly. And.....The music sounds fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: AMR58

customer_reviews.title: Volume control would be nice for Android devices
customer_reviews.text: The one draw back is the simple control. Volume control would be nice for Android devices. Sound is detailed and very broad. Highs, mids and lows are all nicely balanced.
customer_reviews.author: ECP

customer_reviews.title: really thin sound
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to spend $50-100 to get an impressive sound. These are pretty thin. The stock earbuds from my Sansa mp3 player sound nearly as good.. Going to replace with a set of $40 Sennheiser earbuds and we'll see. Sennheiser has been pretty great in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Very good noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: Sounds quality is top notch. Very good noise canceling. Sound definitely seems to mellow, improve with use.
customer_reviews.author: trey shomin

customer_reviews.title: Don't love the fit of the buds but DO love the ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't love the fit of the buds but DO love the sound! Would probably buy them again if the buttons worked a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great sound,  comfortable ear buds stay in place, great value
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, especially for the price. As mentioned elsewhere the thin cords tangle more easily than thicker, stiffer cords which prevents me from giving 5 stars. I would be willing to pay a bit more for sturdier cords.
customer_reviews.author: L. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Best phone headphones period
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time on conference calls, sometimes via VOIP tech (ie skype etc) with participants who are often ESL and in different countries. These make listening much easier than any other headphones by far. Music also sounds quality though not true audiophile hi-fi. Though lossless is not practical on phones so it seem a fine compromise.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I jumped into the headphone market with these as a first pair. The fit is awesome - hardly feel them and the sound is outstanding. I personally would like a little more bass but like I said that's a personal thing. My only concern is going forward I'm going to have to spend significantly more to find headphones as good as these
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bibb

customer_reviews.title: amazing sound ;
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds are amazing, though the bass isn't "spine tingling" for me but that could be my ears. I hate earbuds because they never fit right but Klipsch got it right with these. The software on play store is crap, will not work right with my RAZR. But that doesn't take away from the quality of these buds.
customer_reviews.author: tazman64

customer_reviews.title: great headphones, not for working out
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality but not very good for working out. All the provided sizes fall out of my ears and the big ones are too big. If I'm just sitting around or walking they are great though.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I remember Klipsch as one of the premier speaker manufacturers, so I thought I'd try their headphones. I'm perfectly happy with them and would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: G. L. Beach

customer_reviews.title: but these sound good come in a travel case to stay clean
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, but these sound good come in a travel case to stay clean.
customer_reviews.author: texastutt

product_meta.title: Klipsch Image S4A In-ear Headphones Black for Android (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe first in-ear headphone that works with most Android based devices. Patented oval tips with award winning Klipsch S4 sound. Customize the control over your Android based devices music and phone functions.
feature_bullets: These headphones come with three different sizes of washable ear tips; a small/medium dual flange design as well as medium and large single flange designs. So light and narrow, they are almost impossible to feel inside your ears.

The Image S4a delivers strikingly realistic sound through the use of a single, moving coil drive per channel. These drivers cover a wide frequency range with dynamic detail. From heart-pounding bass to spine-tingling guitar riffs, you won't miss a beat

With the free Klipsch Control App, you can customize functionality of your calls and music. Noise-isolating locks you into the moment. In-case you ever take them out, the unstoppable S4A comes with a protective carrying case.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars418 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
